intro: Zeravschania kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdagh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Kopetdagh mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
